str2: From philos and storge; fond of natural relatives, i.e. Fraternal towards fellow Christian.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Brotherly love, love of Christian brethren. From philadelphos; fraternal affection.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lead onward by example, go before, prefer. From pro and hegeomai; to lead the way for others, i.e. Show deference.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
